Uses of Package
rr.event

  • Packages that use rr.event 
    Package Description
    rr.barrier  
    rr.event  
    rr.simple  
    rr.state  
    rr.tool  
  • Classes in rr.event used by rr.barrier 
    Class and Description
    Event
    Common superclass of all events.
  • Classes in rr.event used by rr.event 
    Class and Description
    AccessEvent
    Represents an access (read or write) event by the target program.
    AccessEvent.Kind
    What kind of access: FIELD: to a (static or non-static) non-volatile field; ARRAY: to an array element; or VOLATILE to a (static or non-static) volatile field.
    Event
    Common superclass of all events.
    FieldAccessEvent
    Represents field accesses (reads or writes) performed by the target program.
  • Classes in rr.event used by rr.simple 
    Class and Description
    AccessEvent
    Represents an access (read or write) event by the target program.
    AcquireEvent
    An event that represents an acquire operation of the target program.
    ClassInitializedEvent
    An event generated when the JVM finishes initializing the static fields of a class.
    InterruptEvent
    An Event generated when one thread explicitly invokes interrupt on another.
    JoinEvent
    Represents a call to Thread.join by the target program.
    MethodEvent
    Represents a method call or return operation in the target program.
    NotifyEvent
    Represents a call to Object.notify() or Object.notifyAll() in the target program.
    ReleaseEvent
    Represents a release event (end of a synchronized block or method) of the target program.
    SleepEvent
    Represents a call to Thread.slepp() in the target program.
    StartEvent
    Represents a call to Thread.start() in the target program.
    VolatileAccessEvent
    Represents an access to a volatile variable by the target program.
    WaitEvent
    Represents a call to Object.wait() by the target program.
  • Classes in rr.event used by rr.state 
    Class and Description
    AcquireEvent
    An event that represents an acquire operation of the target program.
    ArrayAccessEvent
    An Event representing an array access (read or write) operation of the target program.
    ClassInitializedEvent
    An event generated when the JVM finishes initializing the static fields of a class.
    FieldAccessEvent
    Represents field accesses (reads or writes) performed by the target program.

    Represents a call to Thread.join by the target program.

    Represents a method call or return operation in the target program.

    ReleaseEvent
    Represents a release event (end of a synchronized block or method) of the target program.
    SleepEvent
    Represents a call to Thread.slepp() in the target program.
    StartEvent
    Represents a call to Thread.start() in the target program.
    VolatileAccessEvent

    WaitEvent
